node_1: inception: music from the motion picture
edge: The score for Inception was written by Hans Zimmer.

node_1: main article: inception: music from the motion picture
edge: Inception is the movie in which the music composition 'Inception: Music from the Motion Picture' was created.

node_2: inception: music from the motion picture
edge: Édith Piaf's "Non, je ne regrette rien" ("No, I Regret Nothing") appears throughout the film and was reworked into cues of the score.

node_2: édith piaf's "non, je ne regrette rien" ("no, i regret nothing")
edge: Hans Zimmer reworked pieces of Édith Piaf's "Non, je ne regrette rien" ("No, I Regret Nothing") into cues of the score.

node_1: édith piaf's "non, je ne regrette rien" ("no, i regret nothing")
edge: Édith Piaf's "Non, je ne regrette rien" ("No, I Regret Nothing") is accurately timed to match the dreams in Inception.

node_2: édith piaf's "non, je ne regrette rien" ("no, i regret nothing")
edge: Hans Zimmer used a guitar sound reminiscent of Ennio Morricone, played by Johnny Marr, former guitarist of the Smiths.

node_2: inception: music from the motion picture
edge: A soundtrack album for Inception: Music from the Motion Picture was released by Reprise Records on July 11, 2010.
The majority of the score for Inception: Music from the Motion Picture was included in high resolution 5.1 surround sound on the second disc of the two-disc Blu-ray release.
